pageContext.claim: “Not only did I get it done, I got the embassy [in Jerusalem] built for a fraction, a tiny, tiny fraction of the cost of what it was supposed to cost.”
pageContext.analysis: The new U.S. embassy in Jerusalem is a temporary location. It's not a new building; the U.S. refurbished its existing consulate in Jerusalem for about $400,000. Costs for the permanent embassy could well surpass $1 billion when all is said and done.
